title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire on Friday 7 October 2016 - BBC News
summary: assault and dangerous driving arrest by badger cull officers .
cash machine raided at herefordshire garage .
overrunning bridge work brings rush-hour jams in worcester .
pupils put questions to the archbishop of canterbury .

documents.title: west midlands mep to stand for ukip leadership again
text: the west midlands mep bill etheridge has announced he will stand for the ukip leadership again .
one of the favourites , stephen woolfe , has now been discharged from hospital after an altercation with a fellow ukip mep in strasbourg .
with question marks being raised over whether mr woolfe can continue to seek the party leadership , mr etheridge says he can `` no longer '' support his campaign and will now run himself .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: bromsgrove mp sajid javid defends landmark fracking decision
text: bromsgrove mp sajid javid has defended his decision to grant fracking in lancashire after coming under heavy fire from campaign groups and environmentalists .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: police chief to face public questions
text: the west mercia police and crime commisioner , john campion , will face questions from the public at a meeting in the guildhall in worcester next wednesday .
he 'll be appearing before worcester city council 's scrutiny committee .
the council says the meeting is open to the public , but anyone wishing to speak at it needs to register in advance .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : boldly going to a huge star trek convention
text: it 's provided catch phrases which have lasted 50 years .
well , this weekend , fans of star trek will be heading boldly to the nec near birmingham for the european convention .
i 've been along beforehand to meet one of the stars of the show - and you can see more on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Sian Grzeszczyk
Staffordshire Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : rush-hour congestion as bridge work overruns
text: severn trent are trying to find out why water is flowing across the main road bridge in the centre of worcester .
a lane running on to the bridge has been coned off , causing rush-hour delays .

documents.title: latest : assault arrest by badger cull officers : cash machine raid ; bridge work traffic jams

- assault and dangerous driving arrest by badger cull officers
- cash machine raided in herefordshire garage

documents.title: your archbishop meets primary school children at worcester cathedral
text: the archbishop of canterbury has visited worcester cathedral as part of a three-day visit to worcestershire .
while there he spoke to an audience of primary school children .
talking to the 70 primary schools @ twitterid # abcworcdudley
i admire your way to educate the young people , enabling them to meet jesus , and the church 's life .
great deal .

documents.title: cash machine raided in herefordshire garage
text: a cash machine has been stolen from a garage in ledbury in the early hours of this morning .
west mercia police say two men forced their way on to the forecourt of parkway garage in parkway between 00:45 and 02:00 .
they damaged security lighting and cctv cameras and removed the cash machine , but abandoned it when they found it was empty .

documents.title: daughter questions father 's hospital care
text: the daughter of the man who invented guinness ' easy pour system has questioned the management of her father 's care at hereford county hospital before he died .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: travel : lane on worcester bridge to be closed in rush hour
text: severn trent water engineers are trying to find out why water is flowing across the bridge .
works by @ twitterid on # worcester bridge taking longer than anticipated - lane closure needs to remain through peak hour - traffic congestion

documents.title: assault and dangerous driving arrest by badger cull officers
text: a 56-year-old man has been arrested on sus of assault and dangerous driving after an investigation by officers connected to the badger cull , police say .
in august a badger cull managed by the department of environment , food and rural affairs focused in the south west was extended to seven new counties , including herefordshire .

west mercia police say officers working under operation themis , the policing response to the cull , received a report that a man working at a location near tewkesbury on the worcestershire-gloucestershire border , had been assaulted and a car driven at him .
a man from cheltenham was arrested on tuesday and has been released on bail until a date in november , a spokesman said .

documents.title: archbishop visit : the toughest question of all
text: never work with children or animals they say - well the archbishop of canterbury was thrown this curve ball by one of an audience of school children at worcester cathedral .
`` what do you actually do , archbishop ? ''
@ twitterid takes questions from primary school children # abcworcdudley
@ twitterid @ twitterid it 's a bit like being a headmaster is n't it ?

documents.title: travel : bridge to reopen on sunday after tractor damage
text: the bridge , over the railway line running from birmingham to cheltenham , was damaged in may when a stolen tractor crashed into the parapet .
abbotswood bridge ( south of littleton ) @ twitterid due to re-open under temp traffic light control on sun 9 oct following earlier damage

documents.title: cricket : moeen out cheaply as england push for big total
text: worcestershire 's moeen ali was out for six as england chased a big total in the first one day international against bangladesh .
england made 309 , with ben stokes making 101 - the worcestershire all-rounder came to the wicket when the score was already 245-6 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : firearms charge ; bridge damaged by tractor to reopen ; moeen falls cheaply
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :

- bridge hit by stolen tractor to partially reopen at the weekend
- moeen out for six in england one day international in bangladesh

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire players begin winter 'down under '
text: three worcestershire players will tomorrow begin a winter playing in australia .
tom kohler-cadmore will be playing for penrith panthers for a second successive winter , after topping the averages with 533 runs at an average of 59.22 during 2015-2016 .
ed barnard and alex hepburn will be both competing in the same competition - the western australia cricket association first grade - for scarborough and willetton .

documents.title: work begins on new call centre at police hq
text: the new control room at hindlip park , worcester will also be shared by hereford and worcester fire and rescue service when it opens next year .
pcc @ twitterid opens the turf cutting ceremony to mark the start of the work for the new call centre @ twitterid

documents.title: rugby : warriors ready for the `` a serious threat '' at leicester
text: worcester warriors will head to saturday 's aviva premiership clash with leicester tigers with grounds for optimism , while appreciating any game at welford road is likely to be a serious test .

warriors up their first aviva premiership win of the season last weekend when they beat newcastle at sixways , while they will also have ben te'o ( available for selection as he 's recovered from injury .
head coach , carl hogg , says there are obviously positives from their first win , but they know leicester will represent a very serious threat .
they 've got an all-court game , they 're a good side , especially at welford road , but it 's a challenge we 're looking forward to . ''

documents.title: miracle malvern man who feared he would lose his legs climbs four mountains
text: a `` miracle '' patient who feared both his legs would be amputated defied the odds to conquer four mountains in a single day .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: pupils greet archbishop with a song
text: i 'm following the archbishop of canterbury on his three-day visit to worcestershire .
these pupils from regency high school in worcester were on hand to greet him with a song .
author: Alice Porter
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: former mep claims woolfe incident is 'not a one off '
text: the former west midlands ukip mep nikki sinclaire says when she was a member of the party she witnessed violent behaviour at party meetings .
and she described the confrontation yesterday , which left mep steven woolfe needing hospital treatment , as `` not very edifying '' .

ms sinclaire left the party in 2010 after a difference of opinion over the party 's direction and she said there was a lot of frustration among members , because it was a `` melting pot '' of people from different political backgrounds .
but her claims were disputed by current ukip mep roger helmer , who said he had never seen violent confrontations between ukip representatives .

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' squad to travel to leicester tigers
text: dean hammond returns to the side on the wing , while fly-half ryan lamb and hooker jaba bregvadze are in the starting line-up .
you can hear full commentary on the game on bbc hereford & worcester on saturday from 15:00 .
team news | warriors make three changes for trip to @ twitterid
easy trip for @ twitterid are there walk up tickets ?

documents.title: breakingman charged over firearms incident in malvern
text: a 21 year-old man from malvern has been charged with two offences involving an imitation firearm .
west mercia police say the charge follows an incident in the pickersleigh road area of malvern on wednesday .
the man has been remanded in custody and will appear at worcester magistrates ' court today .
a 24-year-old man from malvern has been arrested on sus of attempted murder and has been released on police bail until 17 november .

documents.title: two women assaulted in play nightclub in hereford
text: a woman was bitten on the face as two friends were assaulted in a hereford nightclub .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: you evening sunburst
text: there was the most tremendous sunburst finish to the yesterday , and the army of bbc weather watchers were on hand to capture the moment .
here are a couple from daveywill in kidderminster and snaphappy in littleworth .

documents.title: archbishop to face questions from pupils at two schools
text: the archbishop of canterbury , who 's on a three-day visit to worcestershire , will face questions from pupils at two worcester schools .
justin welby will visit regency high school and bishop perowne church of england college .
pupils at bishop perowne will be asking him questions about the refugee crisis and killings in the name of religion .

documents.title: canal boat death : review to decide inquest evidence
text: a decision will be made today about what evidence will be heard at the inquest into the death of a worcestershire man in a canal .
alan green , who was 49 , died when his canal boat sank in a lock on the droitwich canal in july .
he was a father of six .
a pre-inquest review will be held this morning .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: apology for steamroller owner turned away from test
text: a worcestershire steamroller owner is to be offered a full refund and new driving test , after being turned away by assessors .

neil urquhart , from redditch , says his vehicle has been on the roads since 1927 , but he was told by the driver vehicle standards agency it could n't take a driving test as it did n't have rubber tyres
we are sorry for the inconvenience this has caused .
we will contact mr urquart to rearrange his test as soon as possible and refund the test fee . ''

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: latest : family 'broken ' by teen death ; club appeals to fans after crowd trouble ; archbishop visits
text: here are some of the main stories we are looking at in herefordshire and worcestershire :
- the parents of a herefordshire teenager , whose death was contributed to by significant police failings , say the family is `` broken ''
- hereford fc asks fans to `` take some responsibility '' as the fa investigates crowd trouble
- the most senior member of the church of england is on a three-day visit to worcestershire
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: worcester news front page : water over the bridge
text: engineers are trying to figure out what has caused a large water leak on worcester bridge .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: bulls asks fans to 'take some responsibility ' after crowd trouble
text: supporters have been asked to `` take some responsibility '' by hereford fc after the fa announced the club is under investigation following crowd problems at recent fa cup games .

the bulls have asked fans travelling to their next two away games to exert a `` steadying influence '' on their friends and `` take some responsibility to ensure their companions stay within the limits of acceptable behaviour '' .
the club says it is `` looking at the possibility of serving a number of fans with 12-month banning orders '' .

hereford fc will take no pleasure in handing out banning orders - it would be fantastic to see behaviour improve without the club having to take the most serious action possible against any specific individuals . ''

documents.title: slideshow : racing returns to hereford
text: some images from the first meeting held at hereford racecourse for four years .
pictures by getty and pa .

documents.title: archbishop makes first visit for 20 years
text: the most senior member of the church of england is on a three-day visit to worcestershire .
archbishop of canterbury justin welby is making the first visit of its kind to the county in 20 years .

documents.title: and they 're off
text: a crowd of 4,500 turned out for the first meeting at hereford racecourse in almost four years .
former champion jockey peter scudamore , who hails from herefordshire , was among those delighted the track was now back in action .
there 's a real atmosphere about the place and it 's a real pleasure to be back , it brings back so many fond memories .
hopefully the county continues to support it . ''

documents.title: family of dead teenager `` broken '' after inquest highlights `` police failings ''
text: the family of a teenager who died from hypothermia on a shropshire golf course say they have been `` broken '' by his death .
an inquest into the death of tyrone lock , from hope under dinmore in herefordshire ruled that `` significant police failings '' contributed to his death .
mr lock 's mother tracey lock said she was `` happy to get justice for tyrone '' who `` was a gentleman and a pleasure '' .
`` i 'm so proud to be his mum , '' she added , but said the family was `` broken '' without him .
det ch insp paul moxley said : `` we acknowledge today 's verdict and we will now look to work closely with npas to review future callout procedures .
`` our thoughts remain with the family and friends of tyrone following his tragic death . ''

documents.title: latest : teen death family 'broken ' ; archbishop visits ; steamroller test refund

- family of a teenager who died after `` significant police failings '' say they are `` broken ''

text: police failings in hypothermia death

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back at 08:00 tomorrow with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates through the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: police handed footage 'showing evidence of big cat '
text: west mercia police has been handed video footage which it 's claimed shows evidence of a big cat in south worcestershire .
the force has confirmed it 's received three reports of sightings of a leopard-like creature around upton-upon-severn .
bob lawrence , a big cat expert from west midland safari park , says he 's been contacted by police , but is sceptical of local residents ' claims .
there 'd been a number of reported sightings of a black animal .
i was shown some very grainy video images of this animal taken on a phone and it did look very cat-like but no-one was really sure the range in which the were taken . ''
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: on air : bbc midlands today
text: an inquest into the death of a teenager at a golf course has concluded that `` significant police failings '' contributed to his death .
also on the programme , horse racing has returned to hereford ( above ) for the first time in four years .
you can find out more on bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police respond to tyrone lock inquest verdict
text: west mercia police have been criticised for `` significant failings '' which contributed to the death of 18-year-old tyrone lock from herefordshire at a whitchurch golf course last year .

one of the criticisms was that the force were n't able to call on the support of a police helicopter to help search for the teenager when he fled into the night , wearing just a pair of boxer shorts and his socks .
the force has responded by saying : `` we acknowledge today 's verdict and we will now look to work closely with the national police air service to review future call out procedures . ''
and it added : `` our thoughts remain with the family and friends of tyrone following his tragic death . ''

documents.title: toddler-carrying suspect image released
text: toddler-carrying suspect image released

documents.title: watch : weather for the west midlands
text: remaining breezy , mainly dry and rather cloudy overnight for all of us - the cloud possibly thick enough at times for the odd spot of rain , mainly over higher ground such as the malvern hills .
lows of 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: west ham winger drives 200 miles to hand-deliver shirt
text: a bromsgrove mother says she was `` amazed '' when west ham winger michail antonio drove 200 miles to hand-deliver a shirt for a charity auction set up in memory of her late daughter .
charlotte sharratt and her husband , richard , set up charity little angels after her daughter , libby mae , died at two weeks old from heart complications .
the mother says she could n't believe it when antonio turned up to their charity ball .
he walked in while we were having dinner and left all the guests like open-mouthed as if to say 'who 's that walking in in a tracksuit ? '
it was just amazing that he actually went out of his way to do such a really kind thing for our small charity . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: parents of teenager say police let them him down
text: the father of a herefordshire teenager found dead on a shropshire golf course last november has said the police `` could have saved his life '' , but that they `` let him down '' by not finding him before he died of hypothermia .

tyrone lock , from hope-under-dinmore , had earlier fled police officers at the hill valley hotel near whitchurch and his father jim lock said `` they never acted appropriate , like they should have done '' .
an inquest found `` significant police failings '' had contributed to his death .
his mother , tracey lock , described him as a `` gentleman , loved by everybody '' and said the family felt the police should have done more to find him .
`` i 'm happy to get justice for tyrone , but [ the police ] let us down , they let tyrone down .
tyrone was in a pond for two days and we did n't even know - if they would have looked for tyrone that would have saved us all a lot of heartache and pain . ''

documents.title: your blue skies over worcestershire
text: two cracking showing this morning 's fine weather , both take by bbc weather watchers .
janice took hers in bromsgrove , and j at severn ridge took his in severn stoke .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: latest : 'significant police failings ' in teenager 's death ; arrests after shot fired ; racing returns to hereford
text: today 's headlines include :
- an inquest into the death of a teenager at a golf course has concluded `` significant police failings '' contributed to his death
- two men have been threatened with a baseball bat and a gun in malvern , police say
- racing has returned at hereford for the first time in four years
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: worcester bid to build on first aviva premiership win
text: worcester warriors head to leicester tigers on saturday with the pressure off to some degree after they recorded their first aviva premiership win of the season against newcastle falcons last weekend .
ben te'o and dean hammond are among those players to have recovered from injury and both will be available for selection .
warriors second row darren barry says the 11-9 victory over the falcons had given everyone at the club a major lift .
much needed .
i think one was coming we always felt with the two games here that we drew that a win was on its way , so ( i ) do n't think there [ were ] any panic stations as such . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: cctv system to work with facewatch
text: images from herefordshire 's cctv 's service will be shared with an online portal which is used as a crime reporting tool .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: 'leopard-sized cat believed to have been seen '
text: a `` leopard-sized cat '' was believed to have been seen on three separate occasions in a field in upton-upon-severn , west mercia police said .
the force said it had had no reports of livestock injured or killed .
supt kevin purcell said : `` like many police forces , we occasionally receive reports of believed sightings of a leopard-sized cat .
as a precaution , we are engaging with local wildlife experts and other similar professional organisations in case an animal is located .
`` if anyone believes they see the animal , please note the location and call police on 101 or 999 in an emergency . ''

documents.title: coroner to write to police following teenager 's death
text: the shropshire coroner says he will write to the chief constable of west mercia police , saying lessons must be learnt from the death of a teenager at the hill valley hotel golf club near whitchurch .
an inquest jury concluded this afternoon that `` significant police failings '' contributed to the death of 18-year-old tyrone lock last november .

in a narrative verdict , the jury said the police inappropriately classed him as a suspect , rather than a vulnerable person , when he ran away from officers and that they should have made a second request for a search helicopter , when their first request was turned down .
the inquest heard mr lock died of hypothermia and that his body was not found for 48 hours .
coroner john ellery said he would also write to the national police air service , because there had been a `` clear misunderstanding '' .

documents.title: golf course inquest finds police failings contributed to tyrone lock 's death
text: an inquest into the death of a teenager at a golf course near whitchurch has concluded that `` significant police failings '' contributed to his death .
a jury in telford had heard evidence that tyrone lock , who was 18 and from herefordshire , had been taking drugs before he died .
lock had fled onto the golf course after police were called to reports he had been acting aggressively and his body was found two days later .
the inquest this afternoon recorded a narrative verdict .

documents.title: kidderminster shuttle back page : harriers put promotion credentials to test
text: kidderminster harriers will put their promotion credentials to the test this saturday when league leaders afc fylde visit aggborough .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: your questions : the mystery of the missing memorial bench
text: celia hatfield used your questions to ask : `` what happened to the memorial bench in church road , malvern link ? ''
the bench , which remembered staffordshire-born soldier pte norman caswell sayer , is being repaired .
it will be returned in time for the centenary of his death in april 2017 .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: shot fired as men threatened in malvern
text: two men have been threatened with a baseball bat and a gun in malvern , police say .
west mercia police said the men , in their 20s , were approached by another three at the junction of pickersleigh road and pickersleigh avenue ( about 19:10 .
police say a gun was fired but no-one was injured .
a 24-year-old and a 21-year-old from malvern have been arrested on sus of attempted murder and are currently in police custody , a force spokesman says .

mr woolfe , mep for the north west , was taken to hospital in strasbourg for tests .
hoping all is well and wishing @ twitterid all the best after he was taken ill today in strasbourg

documents.title: on air : bbc midlands today
text: jump racing makes a much-anticipated return to hereford this afternoon , four years after it last took place .
you can find out more on bbc midlands today at 13:30 and 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: worcester news front page : 'he was such a lovely man '
text: police have named the man whose body was found at a flat in tolladine road , worcester , as david jones .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : weather for the herefordshire and worcestershire
text: staying rather cloudy through this afternoon , although there will be some brighter breaks .
it will remain rather breezy too , which will add to the slightly cooler feel .
highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: no driving test on steam roller as it 'does n't have rubber tyres '
text: a worcestershire man has been told he ca n't take a driving test on his steam roller because it does n't have rubber tyres .
neil urquhart ( in the white shirt above ) , who lives in redditch , was due to take a test on the vintage machine , which has metal rollers , today .
mr urquhart explains what happened after he was asked to contact the dvsa .

when i rang them , they said the condition is that the vehicle must be fitted with rubber tyres for it to be operated on the public highway , which is kind of absurd because how could any road roller work if it only has rubber tyres .
it would n't flatten the ground properly , would it ? ''
the bbc has contacted the driver and vehicle standards agency ( dvsa ) but was awaiting a response .

documents.title: never stand by , says bullied teen 's mum
text: never stand by , says bullied teen 's mum

documents.title: latest : thousands expected for racecourse reopening ; 'big cat ' sightings reported to police ; man 'ca n't take driving test on steam roller '
text: today 's headlines include :
- at least 4,000 people are expected at hereford racecourse today as it reopens after a four-year break
- more reported sightings of a big cat in south worcestershire , this time around upton-upon-severn
- a man has been told he ca n't take a driving test on his steam roller because it does n't have rubber tyres
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: football : hereford fc eyeing up target
text: hereford fc manager pete beadle says he 's hoping to further add to his squad in the coming week or so .
westfields ' striker jamie molyneux became the latest player to join the edgar street squad when he signed on tuesday and beadle says they 're eyeing up another target .
we 're hoping to speak to another player this week , one that we 're waiting to get the all-clear to speak to and not sure if it 'd be in before the weekend .
but once we can speak to him , we can look to get him in as soon as possible . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: 'big cat ' sightings reported to police
text: there have been more reported sightings of a big cat in worcestershire , this time in upton-upon-severn .
west mercia police said it had been handed footage which was claimed to show evidence of a big cat and had received three reports of sightings of a leopard-like creature in the area .
peter webb , a former mayor of upton , has n't seen the creature himself but says that did not mean others were not right .
i know that there are two people who have got businesses up on the ham and they both say that they 've seen something and they 're convinced themselves .
i think you 've got to believe something is going on but whether it is in fact a black panther or not , who knows ? ''
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: church to receive estimated £ 1.3m of lottery money
text: a 1,000-year-old church in herefordshire is to receive an estimated £ 1.3m of lottery money to ensure its survival .

st james church in wigmore has played host to many kings and queens over the centuries , but last year its future was looking uncertain until a group of villagers got together to try to find ways to keep it open .
the wigmore centre community interest company has now received £ 170,000 to start installing state-of-the-art facilities .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: addiction charity sets up permanent base in market town
text: an alcohol and drugs treatment service has announced its new base in ross-on-wye .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: 'everything set ' for racecourse reopening
text: hereford & worcester are at hereford racecourse to cover the reopening
good morning everyone - everything set for racing today , the official going is good , good to firm in places .
goof luck to you alĺ at hereford today i hope all goes well today .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid - welcome back , from an irish nh fan
hope it 's a great success !
yeah the day is finally here !
horse racing again at hereford race course .
welcome back !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
looking forward to it , travelling down from manchester for todays racing

documents.title: worcester girl georie gibbs making huge strides six-months after life-changing surgery
text: playing on a slide , using a scooter or chasing after her big sister - one year ago these were things georgie gibbs could only dream of .
author: Evesham Journal

documents.title: latest : thousands expected for racecourse reopening ; 'big cat ' sightings reported to police ; mum wants more leukaemia awareness
text: today 's headlines include :
- at least 4,000 people are expected at hereford racecourse today as it reopens after a four-year break
- more reported sightings of a big cat in south worcestershire , this time around upton-upon-severn in recent weeks
- more needs to be done to make people aware of the signs and symptoms of leukaemia says worcestershire mother
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: sunday politics : 'midlands engine ' and shropshire 's hospitals under the spotlight
text: sunday politics in the midlands is looking at the idea of a `` midlands engine '' to rival the `` northern powerhouse '' and asking what is behind the pr slogans .
it 's also delving into the ongoing row over shropshire a & e services and asking if the county needs two emergency departments .
the guests on the sofa this week will be the conservative mp for south staffordshire , gavin williamson , and the labour mp for wolverhampton north east , emma reynolds .
author: BBC Sunday Politics

documents.title: on the hunt for an unsung hero
text: do you know a local sports volunteer who deserves some much-needed recognition ?
it 's time to let us know .
now in its 14th year , the bbc get inspired unsung hero award celebrates people from around the uk who volunteer their time and efforts to help people participate in sport .
you can nominate until 23 october and the winner will be announced at bbc sports personality of the year .
last year , 92-year-old alec davies from worcester st john 's cycling club was named the west midlands unsung hero .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: staff at youthcomm radio , in worcester , fed up with repeated attempts to hack its system
text: a hacker has been repeatedly targeting worcester 's youthcomm radio , attempting to break into its website and even temporarily taking the station off the air .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: champion jockey 'delighted ' at return of jump racing to hereford racecourse
text: horse racing 's reigning champion jockey , richard johnson , has welcomed the return of jump racing to hereford racecourse , where he rode his first winner .
thousands are expected to be at the site today for the first meeting in four years - the course closed after a dispute between arc racing and herefordshire council over its future .
four meetings are scheduled for this season and richard johnson says it has `` got great memories for me '' .
you get to a point , though , where you think it wo n't reopen , but i 'm delighted it is coming back . ''
author: Tim Race
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: latest : thousands expected for racecourse reopening ; 'big cat ' sightings reported to police ; mum wants more leukaemia awareness
text: this morning 's headlines :
- at least 4,000 people are expected at hereford racecourse today as it reopens after a four-year break
- six months after reported sightings of a big cat in south worcestershire , police say they 've received three reports of sightings around upton-upon-severn in recent weeks
- a worcestershire mother says more needs to be done to make people aware of the signs and symptoms of leukaemia
author: Phil Maiden
Newsreader, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on thursday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police hunt escaped prisoner
text: police are hunting a man who escaped hmp hewell last thursday .
wayne madlen , 45 , has been serving a prison sentence for burglary and theft and is known to have links to bilston , wolverhampton and the west midlands region .
he is described as 5'11 '' to 6 '' tall , with hazel-coloured eyes , a bald head and a distinctive tattoo of a black panther on his right bicep .

documents.title: cause of worcester death remains unknown
text: the police say they still do n't know what caused the death of a man in worcester .
the body of 48-year-old david jones was found at a property on tolladine road in the early hours of monday and a post-mortem examination has been unable to determine what happened .
det ch insp ian wall , who is leading the investigation , added that at this time no further action will be taken against a 46-year-old woman who was originally arrested on sus of murder .

documents.title: your photos : blue skies around herefordshire and worcestershire
text: we 've had blue skies around the two counties today and the bbc weather watchers have been sharing their photos with us .
these ones were taken in bromyard ( top ) and doddenham ( bottom ) this afternoon .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: station signs go gold in honour of paralympians
text: four station signs are to be turned gold in honour of successful british paralympians , london midland has announced .
- bromsgrove : lauren rowles who won rowing gold in the ta mixed double sculls
- kidderminster : claire cashmore , gold medalist in women 's 4x100m medley relay
- stratford-upon-avon : cyclist megan giglia , winner of the women 's c1-2-3 3,000m individual pursuit
- northampton : ellie robinson , who won gold in women 's 50m butterfly
gold boards have already been put up at the stations in sutton coldfield , in honour of cyclist jon-allan butterworth and hemel hempstead , for olympian max whitlock and paralym stretton .

documents.title: ukip leadership : west midlands mep bill etheridge to stand
text: west midlands ukip mep bill etheridge has confirmed he will be standing for his party 's leadership .
it comes after diane james ' decision to step down from the top job last night , after only 18 days in charge .
nigel farage is to lead the party until a fresh contest is completed .
the ukip north west mep steven woolfe has said he will stand for the leadership .
when the leadership election is called i see currently no reason whatsoever why i should n't have another crack .
unless something dramatic happens , some great heroic saviour-type figure appears , then i shall be having a go . ''
ukip nw mep steven woolfe confirms leadership bid `` we can replace labour as the main opposition and stand up for the ignored working class ''
absolutely dillusional
@ twitterid well your leaders last as long as your mp 's , so who knows , tis a funny ol world after all
author: Andrew Easton
Presenter, BBC

documents.title: five arrested in hunt investigation bailed again
text: five people arrested on sus of animal cruelty at a kennel belonging to the south herefordshire hunt have been bailed again .

west mercia police say they are continuing investigations after a video , secretly filmed by activists , appeared to show fox cubs being taken in to a shed where hounds were kept , before being brought out dead .
all hunting activities of the south herefordshire hunt remain suspended while the investigations are taking place .
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: latest : hunt cruelty investigation continues ; eastham bridge repairs could approach £ 2m ; t20 consultation for wccc members
text: our headlines this evening include :
- five arrested in alleged hunt cruelty case bailed again
- cost of eastham bridge repairs expected to reach almost £ 2m
- worcestershire members to be consulted on proposed t20 changes
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire members to be consulted on new t20 proposals
text: worcestershire members are going to be asked what they think of proposals for a new city-based t20 competition .
the eight-team tournament would be staged in addition to the t20 blast and the aim is to broaden the appeal of the sport and to bring in more money .
there will be places for around 50 club members at the meeting on wednesday 19 october .
consultation with members is an extremely important part of this process and something i have been looking forward to doing .
when changes such as these are proposed a clear understanding is of paramount importance to the buy-in of each county . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser front page : historic pub wins 11th-hour reprieve
text: controversial plans to demolish a historical bromsgrove pub branded `` a valuable community asset '' have been put on hold at the eleventh-hour .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: eastham bridge work expected to cost almost £ 2m
text: permanently replacing the collapsed eastham bridge in north worcestershire is set to cost the taxpayer almost £ 2m .
work on a replacement bridge will begin later this month , and it 's expected to be completed by next spring .
worcestershire county council is set to dip into its reserves to pay for part of the bill .

documents.title: latest : five arrested in hunt investigation bailed again ; collapsed bridge to cost taxpayers £ 2m ; champion jockey 'delighted ' at hereford racing return
text: this afternoon 's headlines include :
- five people arrested on sus of animal cruelty at a kennel belonging to the south herefordshire hunt have been bailed again
- the cost to taxpayers of investigating and permanently replacing the collapsed eastham bridge in north worcestershire is set to be almost £ 2m
- horse racing 's reigning champion jockey richard johnson says he is looking forward to racing returning to his home track at hereford
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your nature 's camouflage
text: a nice visual challenge from herefordshire wildlife trust .

text: have you got a question about hereford & worcester ?
ask us here and your question could be making the news .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: worker gets finger trapped in machinery
text: a worker has been freed after getting a finger trapped in machinery at the kerry ingredients factory , on the shropshire-worcestershire border .
firefighters were called to the site at burford , near tenbury wells , at 02:40 and it took half an hour to free him .
the ambulance service says he was taken to worcester royal infirmary for treatment .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: more than 900 accidents involving west mercia police cars over three years
text: there have been 949 accidents involving west mercia police cars between 2013 and 2015 .
of those , 331 involved unmarked police and they resulted in 23 injuries .
west mercia police says that its officers adhere to nationally approved driver training standards which are governed by the college of policing .

documents.title: appeal for witnesses following burglary in bromsgrove
text: a house in bromsgrove is believed to have been targeted in an armed raid yesterday .
police say the home on old birmingham road in lickey end was broken into at about 17:00 .
three offenders , one reported to be carrying a firearm , took a number of watches , including a rolex , before making off on a black motorbike towards rednal .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: worcester news back page : te'o should have rejected warriors says guscott
text: former england and bath centre jeremy guscott believes england hopeful ben te'o has joined the `` wrong club '' in worcester warriors .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : behind the scenes of an online giant 's recruitment drive
text: as the online retailer amazon launches a recruitment drive to find 4,500 workers for its staffordshire centre , we 'll be getting a rare look behind the scenes .
the staff are wanted because the internet giant says it needs to meet demand over the christmas break .
i 'll have more on midlands today from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: father speaks of son 's death
text: the father of a kidderminster man , who had been unable to move since being paralysed in a motorcycle crash six years ago , says his son would n't have wanted to live as long as he did .
yesterday an inquest found 49-year-old richard rudd died from pneumonia and an infection as a result of a crash in 2009 .
he 'd narrowly survived having his life support machine turned off several years ago after a doctor discovered he was able to move his eyes in response to questions .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: latest : mep not ruling out another ukip leader bid ; fostering blamed for accommodation struggle ; hundreds of police cars involved in crashes
text: this lunchtime , our headlines include :
- the west midlands ukip mep bill etheridge says he 's not ruling out another bid to become the party 's leader
- a worcestershire mother , who claims she has n't been allowed to rent a seven-bedroom house due to having foster children , says they 'll struggle to find alternative accommodation
- almost 950 police cars belonging to the west mercia force have been involved in crashes over the past three years , according to newly released figures
author: Phil Maiden
Newsreader, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: travel : rail delay warning
text: a warning of rail delays if you 're travelling between bromsgrove and droitwich spa .
due to an obstruction on the line between bromsgrove and droitwich spa , services running through these stations may be delayed

documents.title: two rare rothschild 's giraffes named
text: two new giraffe calves recently born at west midlands safari park have been named
the male and female rothschild 's giraffes , born within a few days of each other , have been called embu and emali , after two towns in kenya .
rothschild 's giraffes are rare , with fewer than 2,500 thought to be left in the wild .

documents.title: worcester news front page : cruel bullying killed my son
text: the mother of a worcester teenager who took his own life after being bullied online has penned a powerful open letter calling on people to do more to prevent other young lives being lost .

documents.title: weather : a sunny afternoon ahead
text: we 're expecting a sunny afternoon in herefordshire and worcestershire , with temperatures reaching 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest : mep not ruling out another ukip leader bid ; fostering blamed for accommodation struggle ; father speaks on son 's death
text: this morning 's headlines :
- the west midlands ukip mep bill etheridge says he 's not ruling out another bid to become the party 's leader
- a worcestershire mother , who claims she has n't been allowed to rent a seven-bedroom house due to having foster children , says they 'll struggle to find alternative accommodation
- the father of a kidderminster man , who 'd been unable to move since being paralysed in a motorcycle crash six years ago , says his son would n't have wanted to live as long as he did
author: Phil Maiden
Newsreader, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: inquest continues into death of teenager at golf club
text: the inquest continues today into the death of herefordshire teenager tyrone lock at a whitchurch golf club .

yesterday , police dog handler pc ian willes gave evidence and explained how he tracked tree-lines and water areas for 40 minutes , and at one point heard a voice shouting `` leonard '' - the name of lock 's friend .

pc willes said the police dog up a scent though it could n't be determined if it was tyrone 's and the jury heard that pc willes had unwittingly searched near to the pond where tyrone lock 's body was found two days later .
the jury has been asked to consider whether west mercia police took appropriate action in their search for tyrone .

documents.title: mep 'not ruling out ' another bid to be ukip leader
text: the west midlands ukip mep bill etheridge says he 's not ruling out another bid to become the party 's leader .
mr etheridge missed out in the last leadership election to diane james , who has announced she 's resigning after 18 days in the role .
nigel farage has said he is still technically leader but has told the bbc he wo n't be contesting any future leadership contest and mr etheridge says that 's what he 's been told as well .

i had a fairly forthright conversation with him [ nigel farage ] about this earlier and i 'm very much assured that he wo n't be standing again although to be honest with you i wish he 'd never stood down . ''
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watcher wolverley and lyonshall
text: our bbc weather watchers keep us updated on the local forecasts where they are in herefordshire or worcestershire .
they also send in great too - here are two from users weather geek in wolverley and johnqa in lyonshall

documents.title: hereford racecourse owners welcome entries
text: the owners of hereford racecourse say they 're delighted at the number of entries they 've had for thursday 's jump meeting - the first time national hunt racing has been held at the course for four years .
local trainers michael scudamore , tom symonds and kerry lee will have runners among more than 130 entries for the seven jump races .

champion jockey richard johnson will also be in action on his home course and will be aiming for a victory in front of the rusty bridge restaurant , newly named after his first career winner which he rode at hereford as a 17-year-old .

documents.title: mum of worcester teenager who killed himself calls for action on cyberbullying
text: the mother of a worcester teenager who took his own life after being bullied online has penned a powerful open letter calling on people to do more to prevent other young lives being lost .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: latest : trial halts for man accused of 11 deaths ; man speaks out about death of son
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- a worcester man accused of attempting to murder 11 people has had his trial halted after his lawyer failed to turn up
- kidderminster man speaks out about death of son following motorcycle crash
- a worcestershire mother claims says her family were n't allowed to rent a herefordshire farmhouse , because the owners did n't want foster children running around the property
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it 'll be dry today with somebright and sunny spells .
it 'll be breezy at times with variable amounts of cloud .
highs of 16c ( 61f ) .

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on wednesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: midlands today : inquest into death of teenager
text: we 'll have news from an inquest into the death of a teenager , tyrone lock ( below ) , from hope under dinmore near leominster , whose body was found at a golf course .
also on the programme , a once-struggling group of dairy farmers have turned their fortunes around by exporting cheese to the us .
they 've tapped into a growing demand for organic milk .
you can find out more on bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : weather for the west midlands
text: it will remain dry for all of us tonight , with some patchy cloud around .
the cloud should keep temperatures up too , making it milder than last night , helped by a keen south-easterly breeze .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: man caught drug driving 12 days after passing his test
text: a 21-year-old has been banned from driving- just 12 days after passing his test- after being caught drug driving .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: inquest hears about struggle of man paralysed by road crash
text: an inquest has been hearing about the overwhelming injuries a paralysed man from kidderminster had to battle with as the result of a road traffic collision .
the coroner found richard rudd , 49 , died from pneumonia and an infection in 2009 .
his family had an agonising decision about whether to switch his ventilator off and were at the hearing in gloucestershire today .
author: Michael Perkins
BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your photos : sun-drenched british camp
text: david bright sent us this lovely view from british camp in the malvern hills .
you can email us your photos or tweet or send them via facebook .

documents.title: council overpaid road repair firm millions
text: millions of pounds will be coming back to herefordshire council after the high court ruled it had overpaid a company that was employed to carry out road repairs across the county .
between 2003 and 2013 , the council paid amey wye valley limited £ 204m to carry out work on roads , council buildings and services such as catering and printing .
yesterday at the high court in london it was ruled the council was entitled to get £ 9.5m back from amey and also have the fees it had paid to adjudicators refunded .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: headlines : arrests after girl , two , found wandering alone ; council overpaid road firm 'millions '
text: some of the main stories today include :
- two women have been arrested on sus of child neglect in worcester after a two-year-old girl was found wandering on her own
- millions of pounds will be coming back to herefordshire council after the high court ruled it had overpaid a company that was employed to carry out road repairs across the county
- a backlog of more than 11,000 x-rays of patients in worcestershire will not be fully cleared before the end of november
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: country car park 's temporary closure
text: a car park at arrow valley country park will be closed next tuesday morning , 11 october , while markings are put in place .
the area , off battens drive , will reopen in the afternoon so residents `` are urged to bear with us and park elsewhere during that time , '' redditch borough council said .

documents.title: ledbury rugby player left with serious facial injuries following assault 15 minutes into match
text: a ledbury rugby player was left with serious facial injuries after he was assaulted 15 minutes into a game .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: worcester wolves 'will be alright ' - mcwhorter
text: worcester wolves ' latest arrival is confident they can turn around their form .
there have been two defeats from their opening three matches , but deondre mcwhorter feels things will .
up quickly .
he said : `` yeah it was a rough one , but for me just getting here i guess we could kind of say we 're still trying to find out who we are and how we 're run .
`` but we 'll get back to it .
we 'll be alright in the coming weeks . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: king john anniversary production
text: a production of king john commemorating the 800th anniversary of his death will be staged around his final resting place in worcester cathedral .
the worcester repertory company will stage the production , which will run from tuesday 18 october to saturday 22 october at the quire of the cathedral .

documents.title: force targets students in recruitment drive
text: west mercia police is targeting university students as part of a new recruitment drive .
the police now campaign was first piloted in london and it 's now being rolled out elsewhere .
the two-year programme is similar to teach first - fast-tracking graduates much quicker than normal applicants .
author: Michael Perkins
BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: one-way system in place in widemarsh street until january
text: there will be a one-way system in place in a part of widemarsh street until january as works are carried out for the new link road junction .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: weather watchers : beautiful blue sky in worcester
text: we 're featuring some of the photos that have been sent to bbc weather watchers - this one was taken by 42shades in worcester .

documents.title: headlines : women arrested after girl , two , found wandering alone ; council overpaid road firm 'millions '
text: some of the main stories today include :
- two women have been arrested on sus of child neglect in worcester after a two-year-old girl was found wandering on her own
- millions of pounds will be coming back to herefordshire council after the high court ruled it had overpaid a company that was employed to carry out road repairs across the county
- a backlog of more than 11,000 x-rays of patients in worcestershire will not be fully cleared before the end of november
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: high level of nursing vacancies in county
text: the trust which runs the county hospital currently has 254 vacancies with 70 % of these in nursing .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: benali running and cycling challenge comes to worcester
text: a former footballer has begun an attempt to run and cycle to every premier league and championship stadium in two weeks - and tonight he comes into worcester with a former teammate .
francis benali ( above ) , who made more than 300 appearances for southampton , will be finishing his latest leg at the cathedral later with ex-england international matt le tissier .
benali is aiming to run a marathon and cycle about 75 miles ( 120km ) each day .
he set off from bournemouth a couple of days ago in the challenge to raise £ 1m for cancer research uk .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: football action tonight
text: redditch united and evesham united will be in southern league cup first-round action this evening .
redditch welcome stratford town to valley stadium , while evesham head to leamington .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: father-of-three 's remains to be exhumed as wife 's dying wish is granted
text: the remains of an alvechurch man will be exhumed and reburied with his wife , as a result of their three sons ' quest to reunite their parents in death .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: midlands today : dairy farms eye us
text: a once-struggling group of dairy farmers have turned their fortunes around by exporting cheese to the us .
they 've tapped into a growing demand for organic milk .
you can find out more on bbc midlands today at 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: balloon release crackdown powers used twice by worcester city council
text: council chiefs have intervened in two outdoor events in worcester involving balloon releases using their new controversial crackdown powers , it has emerged .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: women held after girl , two , found wandering alone
text: two women have been arrested on sus of child neglect after a two-year-old girl was found wandering on her own .
the girl was found in the tolladine area of worcester on saturday morning .
she was found to have no serious injuries and is now being cared for by family members .
the two women , aged 30 and 44 , have been released on police bail .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: headlines : women arrested after girl , two , found wandering alone ; council overpaid road firm 'millions '
text: some of the main stories today include :
- two women have been arrested on sus of child neglect in worcester after a two-year-old girl was found wandering on her own
- millions of pounds will be coming back to herefordshire council after the high court ruled it had overpaid a company that was employed to carry out road repairs across the county
- a backlog of more than 11,000 x-rays of patients in worcestershire will not be fully cleared before the end of november
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : weather for the west midlands
text: we will all have a fine and dry day today .
there will be some cloud around , and despite it being rather breezy at times , it should feel quite warm in sunny spells .
highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: woman held on sus of murder released
text: a 46-year-old woman arrested on sus of murdering a man in worcester has been released on bail until 10 october .
the 48-year-old man 's body was found at a property just off tolladine road on monday morning .
a post-mortem examination was taking place today .
west mercia police said it was remaining 'open minded ' as to the cause of the death .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: worcester cavaliers beaten by newcastle falcons
text: worcester cavaliers were last night beaten 39-18 by newcastle falcons in their a league match at sixways .
the cavaliers scored three tries through andy short , freddie davison and alex hearle .

documents.title: councillor claims domestic abuse is a problem in county
text: herefordshire has a problem with domestic abuse , a cabinet councillor told a full council meeting .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: thousands expected at return of jump racing
text: more than 4,000 people are expected to be at hereford racecourse on thursday when it stages the first meeting in almost four years .
no jump racing has taken place there since 2012 after arc racing and herefordshire council got into dispute about the future of the course .
four meetings are scheduled for this season and it is hoped up to a dozen could take place next season if the reopening is a success .
more than 1,600 advance tickets have been sold and staff are expecting another 3,000 racing fans to turn up on thursday .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: post-mortem examination due on body
text: a post-mortem examination is due to be carried out today on the body of a worcester man who was found at a property in the city .
a 46-year old woman was arrested on sus of murder , but west mercia police says it is remaining 'open minded ' as to the cause of the death .
the man 's body was found at a property just off tolladine road .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: headlines : post mortem due on worcester body ; more than 1,600 to watch jump racing return
text: some of the main stories today include :
- a post mortem is due on the body of a worcester man who was found at a property in the city
- a backlog of more than 11,000 x-rays of patients in worcestershire will not be fully cleared before the end of november
- more than 1,600 tickets have been sold for the return after four years of jump racing in hereford
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: x-rays backlog not fully cleared before end november
text: a backlog of more than 11,000 x-rays of patients in worcestershire will not be fully cleared before the end of november .
earlier this summer the county 's acute trust admitted the backlog of scans - some potentially life-saving - existed .
when any x-ray is carried out , it is first reviewed by the doctor or nurse who wanted it and then later by a radiologist .
if it had been following its own rules , the trust that runs worcestershire 's acute hospitals would check all these x-rays within a fortnight .
the trust has launched its own independent review of radiology .
health bosses now say all urgent x-rays have now been checked , although about half of x-rays from 2014 and 2015 have not been reviewed .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: get face-to-face with perseus and andromeda
text: visitors to a ruined stately home in worcestershire have a `` once in a lifetime '' chance get a close look at its famous fountain , which is being restored .
a viewing platform is being put up around the perseus and andromeda fountain at witley court .
english heritage , which looks after the ruined house and its grounds , says the platform will be in place until 28 november .
designed by james forsyth in portland stone and featuring 120 jets hidden among sculptures of shells , sea nymphs and dolphins , the fountain is to be fully cleaned and restored by april .
witley court is now a spectacular ruin after a devastating fire in 1937 .

documents.title: woman held over body find
text: a woman has been arrested after the body of a man was found in a flat in worcester .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: your chaddesley corbett
text: weather watcher conan sent in this simply stunning from chaddesley corbett .
all the different colours are incredible .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: headlines : post mortem due on city body ; more than 1,600 to watch jump racing return
text: good morning .
some of the main stories we are looking at include :
- post mortem due on the body of a worcester man who was found at a property in the city .
- a backlog of more than 11,000 x-rays of patients in worcestershire wo n't be fully cleared before the end of november
- more than 1,600 hundred tickets have been sold for the return after four years of jump racing in hereford

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: early morning mist and fog likely on another largely dry and fine day .
there 'll be more cloud around at times through the day but there 'll also be some sunshine .
highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to hereford and worcester local live on tuesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: another week , another leadership result
text: another week , another leadership result
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it 'll be a dry but chilly night for most of us - lows of 6c ( 43f ) .
tomorrow it should be a dry day with some bright or sunny spells and generally light winds .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .

documents.title: appeal for witnesses after redditch attack
text: police are investigating reports of an assault that took place close to valley stadium in redditch .
the incident happened at about 16:00 last wednesday , when a teenage boy was walking along a track between bromsgrove road and redditch football club , west mercia police says .
it is believed an unknown man approached the teenager from behind , before grabbing his shoulder and hitting him a number of times .
the victim fell to the ground and was further assaulted by up to three men .
police have described it as an `` isolated '' incident and are keen to hear from anyone who witnessed the attack .

documents.title: teenager 'high on drugs ' and 'acting agressively '
text: an inquest into the death of 18-year-old tyrone lock has been told he was high on ecstacy and the illegal herbal stimulant khat on 20 november last year .
he was seen on cctv threatening the night manager at the hill valley hotel at whitchurch .
police were called and when they arrived , the inquest heard he ran outside to evade questioning , wearing just his boxer shorts and socks in temperatures just over 4c ( 39f ) .
his body was found two days later by the greenskeeper in a pond on the golf course .
the inquest is set to last all week .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: environment agency out helping fish in worcestershire
text: environment agency teams are out today at ipsley pool in redditch undertaking emergency aeration to increase o2 levels to protect fish .

documents.title: west midlands tipped for more big distribution warehouses
text: more big distribution warehouses are likely to be built in the west midlands , according to a leading businessman in the region .
that 's despite plans to close a major plumbing distribution centre in worcester , which emerged last week .
amazon already has a depot in the west midlands and there are plans to add more rail freight hubs .
david frost , chair of a local enterprise partnership , says they 're essential to keep goods moving whether we 're in the european union or not .
more on inside out in the west midlands from 19:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: teenager 'might have survived in found earlier '
text: an inquest in telford has been told that a teenager who died from hypothermia while being searched for by police , might have survived if he 'd been found within two hours .
the body of tyrone lock from hope under dinmore near leominster , was discovered on a golf course in whitchurch , 48 hours after officers were called to reports he was acting erratically at a hotel .
the hearing in front of a jury is expected to last all week .

documents.title: watch : worcester drone pilot competes in national championships
text: matthew evans from worcester was one of 60 drone pilots bidding to be named britain 's best .
national championships took place at ragley hall in warwickshire at the weekend .

documents.title: man airlifted to hospital after found outside police station with head injuries
text: a man was found with suspected arm and head injuries in the backyard of worcester police station in castle street on sunday afternoon .
a member of the public found the 33-year-old at approximately 16:45 and an air ambulance was called , landing on the nearby racecourse .
a 44-year-old man has been arrested on sus of assault , and has been released on police bail until 31 october .

documents.title: latest : drone dropped 'escape kit ' into worcestershire prison ; man bailed after stabbing
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this afternoon :
- the prison officers association calls for more to be done to prevent drones from flying over prisons , after an escape kit was dropped into hmp hewell
- bromsgrove mp and communities secretary sajid javid has attacked `` nimbyism '' as he called for a million new homes to be built by 2020
- a man is released on bail after being questioned on sus of stabbing another man in worcester
author: Alice Porter
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: paralympian given freedom of county
text: paralympian given freedom of county

documents.title: man found with a knife in public said it was a cry for help
text: a father who was left traumatised after seeing his girlfriend have an emergency caesarean section was arrested after being found with a knife in public .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: football : home ties in fa cup for local clubs
text: both of our remaining clubs in the fa cup have been handed home ties in today 's draw for the fourth qualifying round .
kidderminster harriers will host weymouth , while westfields will be at home to suffolk-based leiston town .
the ties are due to be played on saturday , 15 october .

documents.title: man released on bail after worcester stabbing
text: a 33-year-old man has been released on bail after being questioned on sus of stabbing another man in worcester on friday .
officers were called to the hopmarket area of the city after reports of an attack and an injured man was later found on the sabrina bridge .
his injuries were not thought to be life threatening .

documents.title: pear trees harvested for perry
text: every year pear trees outside our studios produce lots of fruit that goes to waste .
this year , a local cider company asked if they could have them .
we said yes .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: national awards for local herefordshire beef
text: a locally owned and run family business in herefordshire has scooped two prestigious national awards for its beef .
oakchurch country department store at staunton-on-wye has been acknowledged for its efforts by two great taste awards , one for its rib-eye steak and another for its home-made steak and ale pies .
we are all absolutely delighted with the news .
we count ourselves to be so lucky to be located in rural herefordshire where amazing food is always available in great abundance , right here on our doorstep . ''
